column4: i just plugged in a usb drive.. how can i find what dev it is one
on
sudo lsusb should do it.
ah, sorry.  I would try "mount -l"
that's a small L
I believe USB stuff gets assigned to the scsi bus by the system so it will show up as sda, sdb, etc.
or you could do "cat proc/scsi/scsi"
oops...forgot a leading slash. that's "cat /proc/scsi/scsi"
please describe what you are trying to do and what kind of device it is.
i have http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.asp?Item=N82E16817146057
i want to partition it w/ cfdisk or a better util if i have one.. and then format it
it is using the usb2 interface aTM
OK, an external SATA drive.  If it is USB, it should be automounted by hotplug and assigned a device name by udev.
it is a sata2 drive in the enclosure and connected to the pc w/ the usb interface
i really think that "mount -l" should give you the device name if it is mounted.
lol...duh.  Did you try "fdisk -l"?
np. it should have worked!!!
i mean it should have modprobed the scsi driver automatically when it detected it.
ok. you should be fine.
i'm afraid i don't have any experience with reiser so i can't comment. i just stick with ext3.
i'm off to bed now. glad you got things going. later...
